product_name: CliniqueRedness Solutions Makeup Broad Spectrum SPF 15 With Probiotic Technology Foundation
summary: SummaryHighlightsSustainable PackagingClinique Redness Solutions Makeup is a soothing, oil-free foundation that treats and covers redness with a naturally pretty touch.
details: DetailsBenefitsSkin Types: Very Dry to Dry, Combination Oily, Dry Combination.Coverage: Moderate.Finish: Natural.Instantly color-corrects flushing, blushing.Comforts redness-prone skin as it covers.Over time, reduces the look of redness on bare skin.Helps protect with SPF.Dermatologist and ophthalmologist tested.Non-acnegenic.Allergy tested.Formulated WithoutParabensPhthalatesOil-freeFragranceItem 2567629How To UseApply after using your Redness Solutions Redness Regimen or 3-Step Skin Care.Shake bottle well. Squeeze a few drops of foundation onto the back of your clean hand.With Foundation or Brush or clean fingertips, smooth makeup into skin, starting in center of face, blending out toward hairline and jawline.Remove with your favourite Clinique oil-free makeup remover.IngredientsActive: Octinoxate 5.90%, Titanium Dioxide 3.70%, Zinc Oxide 2.90%. Inactive: Water\Aqua\Eau, Methyl Trimethicone, Phenyl Trimethicone, Dimethicone, Triethylhexanoin, Butylene Glycol, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, PEG-10 Dimethicone, Lauryl PEG-9 Polydimethylsiloxyethyl Dimethicone, Aluminum Hydroxide, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Lactobacillus Ferment, Citrus Grandis (Grapefruit) Peel Extract, Magnolia Grandiflora Bark Extract, Poria Cocos Sclerotium Extract, Astrocaryum Murumuru Seed Butter, Glycerin, Caffeine, Sodium Myristoyl Sarcosinate, Caprylyl Methicone, Methicone, Polyglyceryl-6 Polyricinoleate, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Acetyl Glucosamine, Isopropyl Titanium Triisostearate, Dimethicone Crosspolymer-3, Lecithin, Tocopheryl Acetate, Laureth-7, Dimethicone / PEG-10 / 15 Crosspolymer, Sodium Chloride, Dipropylene Glycol, Disodium EDTA, Polyaminopropyl Biguanide, Phenoxyethanol. May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499).Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply after using your Redness Solutions Redness Regimen or 3-Step Skin Care.Shake bottle well. Squeeze a few drops of foundation onto the back of your clean hand.With Foundation or Brush or clean fingertips, smooth makeup into skin, starting in center of face, blending out toward hairline and jawline.Remove with your favourite Clinique oil-free makeup remover.

reviews.headline: I keep going back to Clinique
reviews.comments: This really does help cover the redness

reviews.headline: Holy Grail for rosacea
reviews.comments: I have tried other foundations, but none of them work as well as this one. It also lasts a long time, so it's worth the money.

reviews.headline: Works but isn't light enough
reviews.comments: Im a pretty normal "very fair" to "fair" skin tone in other foundations. The lightest option was too dark on my skin. Its such a bummer because the product works well to conceal redness. But i cant use it.

reviews.headline: Works for covering eczema flares
reviews.comments: This past December/January i was experiencing eczema around my eyes and mouth and chin. The worst flare ive had in a while. I know i should not be wearing makeup while my eczema is active but it was the holidays and i wanted a foundation that wouldn't irritate my skin or emphasize dryness. This helped even out my skin tone and didn't irritate my skin. I did also buy the All About Eyes Rich and the 72hr Intense Moisturizer and I believe these 3 products worked great together. I was able to feel normal. The big con is the color selection of this foundation. I am a light medium skin tone and i bought the lightest fair shade. All the colors seem dark and a little orange. This product would be more popular among the sensitive skin community if they could work on the shades. I only wear this foundation when im experiencing a flare. I prefer Dior Forever Matte as my everyday foundation.

reviews.headline: My go-to foundation (59 years old)
reviews.comments:
I have been using this for many years. I have very dry, sensitive skin with redness, and this does a great job covering it up without being cakey. It doesn't settle in my wrinkles. I use a setting spray, which helps me look dewy and makes my makeup last.

Also, I use a heavy Dermalogica moisturizer under my makeup, and this foundation doesn't melt off.

reviews.headline: I will be purchasing this product again
reviews.comments: I am an older woman with uneven skin tone and reddish areas. I had read that this is a great product. They were right! It's lightweight and blends in perfectly with my skin tone. I only apply to areas where I need color correction and then use a powder makeup to finish. Definitely will purchase again!

reviews.headline: Very happy with this product
reviews.comments: Finally, something that helps cover and calm my rosacea!

reviews.headline: It's fine
reviews.comments: Nothing spectacular, but nothing negative either

reviews.headline: Holy Grail as a foundation!
reviews.comments:
I can't sing this makeup's praises enough! Its pore-blurring, light-weight, covers redness, blends well over my skin creams, and has a touch of spf!

I am super picky about foubdation. Id just about given up on even trying to wear foundation. I became curious about this because it was on sale, so on a whim, I bought it.

I honestly didn't expect to love it this much! Its the best!!!

reviews.headline: Does the job well.
reviews.comments: It could have little more coverage in my opinion so I would not need to use corrector, ideally. The shade is good.  I went slightly darker than usual and its a perfect match. It has slightly dewy finish.

reviews.headline: I love it it clear up the redness
reviews.comments: I love it

reviews.headline: I always come back to this foundation
reviews.comments: I have dealt with diagnosed rosacea for about 3 years now. I have combination skin that leans dry on my cheeks. I like that this foundation is gentle on my skin and hasn't caused any flushing or flare-ups. It has a natural finish. It used to feel oily on my skin, but now it blends nicely, and I have no problems layering it over my sunscreen. I've tried four other foundations over the years (including a different Clinique foundation) and this one consistently checks all of the boxes for my sensitive skin. I will continue to use this foundation.

reviews.headline: Clinique
reviews.comments: Love all their products

reviews.headline: Great for my rosacea
reviews.comments: Redness solution really works.

reviews.headline: Perfect to mix with sunscreen
reviews.comments: I mix this with IT Cosmetics Hello Sunshine to make a tinted sunscreen. Applies easily and doesn't sit in my undereye wrinkles.  Love!

reviews.headline: Why the good reviews?
reviews.comments: How can this be greasy while also so dry? I wanted to love it. I'm a huge Clinique fan. But this is not for dry skin. It makes noticeable flaky patches where there were none- every time i use it. Plus, it likes to settle into pores if you try to build up to a medium-full coverage. My regular foundation is IlMakiage and i find that using a redness/color correcting primer under the IlMakiage works much better.

reviews.headline: Perfect Product
reviews.comments: Ive been using this foundation on the daily since it was first introduced. I get so many complements on my skin and it covers my resness beautfully. If you have redness, this is meant for you. If I want a matte finish, I use Laura Mercier Translucent Powder. It pairs perfectly with this foundation. I buy Ivory and Fair. I use the lighter one in the winter and mix the two in the summer for a perfect color. Im fair skinned.

reviews.headline: Really like it
reviews.comments: This foundation is really great, very helpful covering my red face, still experimenting with the amount and what to use too apply it

reviews.headline: Great product. Read this before you try it!
reviews.comments:
Before you get discouraged from some of the negative reviews, understand this - any foundation will disappoint you if:
1) you don't have a general understanding of your skin type (dry, oily, combo - also age) 
2) dont have a good skin care regimen (moisturize, exfoliate is just the start)
3) try a primer
4) use color correctors for targeted issues like redness or hyperpigmentation 
5) get the right color! ask to be color matched! 
6) shake up the product really well before each use
7) decide which application works best for your skin AND the product; fingers, brush - even different brush types, sponges… this will all look very different with the same foundation. You may hate it one way, but love it another way
8) Watch youtube videos from others who've tried the product. You may find someone with similar skin to yours who has some great pointers. 

Taking even just basic steps to care for your skin will give you much more payoff with the products you are using, and will help you make the most educated decision on which makeup products will work best for you and look great on your skin. 
I can't tell you how many times I hated a product at first, returned it, but then went back to try it again after having addressed my skin issues - and loved it. 

So here's my review of this one: I'm 40, typically I'm combo skin but perimenopause has me so extremely dry like the sahara desert. Hyperpigmentation around my eyes. Redness on my cheeks. Broken capillaries around my cheeks and nose. Some fine lines. 
This product addresses all of it. I've been on the hunt for a foundation that gives decent coverage, one that I can wear on no/minimal makeup days or build it up for some glam, one thats hydrating, has some radiance to it, one that doesn't settle or crease, has SPF and other skin caring ingredients… this one checks each box. 

If you dont love it, return it. But do yourself a favor and give it a fair chance considering all that I've laid out for you. Otherwise no matter what you buy, it may disappoint you. And that's no fun.

reviews.headline: Great Foundation
reviews.comments: I LOVE this concealer. I had used Clinique products in the past, but would switch around to others in the last 10 years. After using this concealer, I can honestly say I'm hooked. It looks so natural and is not thick or pasty like some other brands. As a matter of fact, it's super smooth and blends well!! My experience is that it makes me look younger because it doesn't cake into wrinkles making then more prominent.

media.headline: The make up consultant put it on me & I was healed!

faceoff_positive.comments: It's a little better than I expected at covering my red while not being too heavy. I was afraid the color wouldn't work, but it blended great and is nearly invisible on. No pancake face! It's far better than the it! Cosmetics redness foundation. It dies seem like it wears off a little fast, but setting it with a little powder and a setting spray made it last a lot longer. I took a picture with one side completely bare, and one side with nothing applied but a very small drop of this product, blended with a beauty sponge.
faceoff_positive.headline: Works for me!

faceoff_negative.comments: I have naturally very pink skin so I was so excited to see this at the clinique counter. It gives great coverage, lasts a good while and has a good finish to it but no shade matched my skin. I am VERY fair so even the lightest shade was too dark for me, sadly. If this matched my skin color it would have been perfect but since it doesn't I've been mixing it with a lighter foundation to get use out of it.
faceoff_negative.headline: ALMOST what I was looking for

rollup.name: Redness Solutions Makeup Broad Spectrum SPF 15 With Probiotic Technology Foundation
